# smoothedSceneDepth

**Type Property**

An option that provides the distance from the device to real-world objects, averaged across several frames.

## Declaration

```swift
static var smoothedSceneDepth: ARConfiguration.FrameSemantics { get }
```

## Discussion

Enable this option on a world-tracking configuration ([doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARWorldTrackingConfiguration]) to instruct ARKit to provide your app with the distance between the user’s device and the real-world objects pictured in the frame’s [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFrame/capturedImage]. ARKit samples this distance using the LiDAR scanner and provides the results through the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFrame/smoothedSceneDepth] property on the session’s [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSession/currentFrame].

To minimize the difference in LiDAR readings across frames, ARKit processes the data as an average. The averaged readings reduce flickering to create a smoother motion effect when depicting objects with depth, as demonstrated in [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/creating-a-fog-effect-using-scene-depth]. Alternatively, to access a discrete LiDAR reading at the instant the framework creates the current frame, use [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFrame/sceneDepth].

ARKit supports scene depth only on LiDAR-capable devices, so call [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARConfiguration/supportsFrameSemantics(_:)] to ensure device support before attempting to enable scene depth.

## Accessing Depth

- **sceneDepth**: An option that provides the distance from the device to real-world objects viewed through the camera.
